Name: Statuette of Khons
Description: Statuette representing the god Khons, seated, with a human body and the head of a sparrowhawk. He is wearing a short kilt and on his head are the solar disc between horns and the uraeus. The eyes are fashioned with inlays of black glass paste (of which only the left one is preserved). The uraeus has four alveoli at the front, which are filled with coloured glass paste; blue in the two upper ones and red in the lower ones.
